pageContext.claim: “And then in a certain location you know the location [in Brooklyn], they mail the thousand ballots out. Unfortunately, they doubled it up and everybody in this Democrat area got two ballots instead of one.”
pageContext.analysis: This was undoubtedly a big mistake — not a malevolent act as Trump suggests — but it was still fixable. As many as 100,000 ballots that were sent to New York City voters may have been faulty. The New York City Board of Elections acted swiftly to have the vendor responsible for the misprints send new ballots to every voter who might have been affected. The New York Times reported “Voters should only send in the new ballot. But if they send in both the old and new one, the second ballot will override the first, election officials said. The second ballots will be distinguished by a red mark that will be picked up by the board’s ballot-processing machines, according to Frederic M. Umane, one of the city’s elections commissioners.”
